intro: Machaerium cobanense, commonly known as the Coban grass, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Machaerium cobanense is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in ecological restoration projects.
